page.title: 05PRICES THEN AND NOW
page.content: Mrs Yeo the dinner lady lent us a book of prices in 1959,and we went round some of the shops in Combe Martin. Here are some of them.1 drum of table salt now 24p then 1/3, 1 packet shredded wheat now 76p then 1/3,1 bottle of Daddies sauce now 40p then 1/0,1 tin Brasso 98p then 1/4,1 tin baked beans now 76p then 2/8 1 packet flour now 57p then 1/10,1 Dozen eggs now 76p then 3/0, 2 toilet rolls now 68p then 1/0.Now the main list costs Â£24.10 in 1959 it was Â£7/17.Mr Yeos wage was about 8/10s, Average wage today in this area is about Â£100. The food now is about 25% of the wage. It was then 90% of the wage.There were about 60 items all together.
